title: Down + Leave-It Foundations
summary: Introduce impulse control games that keep bodies loose and brains curious.

lessons.title: Relaxed Down
lessons.objective: Teach puppies to fold into a down without pressure or leash pushing.
steps: Lure from sit by moving a treat to the ground between the puppy's paws.
Drag the treat slowly out from their chest so elbows stretch forward.
Mark once elbows hit the mat and feed several treats while they stay down.
Add a release word and reset with a quick hand-target before repeating.
supportGuidelines: Keep lures low; lifting causes stands instead of downs.
Reward calm breathing by feeding in place for three seconds each rep.
Encourage practicing on different mats to generalize.
lessons.safetyNotes: If hips pop sideways dramatically, provide extra padding or switch surfaces.

lessons.title: Leave-It Foundations
lessons.objective: Teach puppies to disengage from tempting items on cue.
steps: Place a treat in your closed fist and present it at the puppy's nose.
Label leave it the moment they sniff, waiting silently for them to back off.
Mark the instant they pull away and reward from your other hand.
Progress to an open palm or toy on the floor once the fist version is solid.
supportGuidelines: Coach handlers to avoid repeating the cue—silence is part of the lesson.
Remind them to release with take it so the puppy learns when it's okay.
Suggest practicing before walks to prep for sidewalk cleanups.
lessons.safetyNotes: Do not try this with dangerous objects; management still matters.

lessons.title: Calm Cat Intro (Optional)
lessons.objective: Create safe, gated exposure for multi-species homes.
steps: Place the puppy on leash behind a gate with you while the cat is in view eating.
Rapid-fire feed the puppy for looking at the cat then back to you.
Add simple cues (sit, hand touch) while the cat moves slowly.
End with a calm down-stay and release the puppy away from the gate.
supportGuidelines: Coach cat guardians to give their pet a tall escape route.
Remind families to keep leashes loose—no tightening when the cat shifts.
Encourage short, frequent sessions instead of marathon stakeouts.
lessons.safetyNotes: Skip live cat practice if either animal is stressed; use stuffed animal rehearsals first.
